captions.text:
My name is Kevin Woods on behalf of expertvillage.com;
phone number is (314) 584-0116. Right now

we are going to talk about blind spots. Actually
there is 8 blind spots around the car. There

is two up front, two on the right side, two
behind you and two on your left side. Basically

when you are checking blind spots you want
to physically turn around and check. You would

trust your physical eyes more so than you
would trust these two mirrors. Do not use

your side mirrors to determine rather or not
you are getting ready to change lanes. They

did a study about 5 years ago and what they
determined was too many younger people were

either the cause of the accident or causing
deaths in changing lanes. So what they came

up with is on the road test from now on you
have to physically check your blind spots

and if you do not consistently check your
blind spot once you are changing lanes, they

more than likely will not pass you. Anytime
the wheel goes to the left or to the right

changing lanes, ensure that you physically
turn around for a second. It's not long, you're

not turning slow and not turning too fast
nor are you staring at anything you just turn

around and try to see if there is something
coming. You don't want to look right over

your shoulder. You actually want to turn around
to see where a car is coming from.

title: How to Pass a Driving Test : How To Avoid Blind spots While Driving

comments.author: Maurice Wilson

comments.text:
OMFG! You absolutely have to use your mirrors to check for a lane change . 
How do you think tractor trailers and buses do it ? Once you are SURE you 
are clear in the SIDE mirrors, THEN turn your head QUICKLY and check the 
blind spot before the change in lane .  Passenger side mirrors were finally 
introduced on ALL cars to cut down on the duration and amount of time 
turned away from the front of the vehicle.﻿
comments.author: forty4life

comments.text:
forty4life, you got it absolutely right. For the test a person would have 
to do it their way, but after that, just turn your head to look directly at 
your side mirrors, (including the glued on blind spot mirrors), then glance 
left or right quickly when it's clear. It's always the ones that don't do 
this that almost hit me. Now I drive with my headlights on all the time. It 
really helps those people to see me.
comments.author: FrankATracy

actually, other cars are not allowed to be in the blind spot of a bus. 
therefore, the bus driver is confident that there are no cars, beside that 
a bus driver always check mirrors so s/he probably knows that there is no 
car.

all the mirrors and all the time be aware what is going on around. All of 
you should stop talking rubbish about blind spot and start teaching how the 
mirrors suppose to be set.
